psytest.bubbles module#

class psytest.bubbles.PSYBubbles(y: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[float64]], r0: float | None = None, rstep: float | None = None, kmax: int = 0, minlength: float | None = None, delta: float | None = None)[source]#

Bases: object

critval(nreps: int = 1000, force: bool = False, test_size: list[float] | float = [0.1, 0.05, 0.01], nobs: int | None = None) → dict[int, ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[float64]]][source]#

Retrieves BSADF critical values using Monte Carlo Simulations.

Parameters:

  • nreps (int) – Number of simulations. Defaults to NREPS (see .utils.constants)

  • force (bool, optional) – Force recalculation. Defaults to False.

  • test_size (list[float] | float, optional) – Significance levels \(\alpha\). Defaults to TEST_SIZE (see .utils.constants)

  • nobs (int | None, optional) – Number of observations for the simulation. Defaults to None, using the length of y.

Raises:

  • TypeError – If nreps is not an integer.

  • ValueError – If nreps is less than 1.

  • TypeError – If force is not a boolean.

  • TypeError – If test_size is not a list or a float.

  • ValueError – If test_size is not in the range (0, 1).

  • TypeError – If nobs is not an integer.

  • ValueError – If nobs is less than 1.

Returns:

Critical values for each \(r_2\).

Return type:

dict[int, NDArray[float64]]

find_bubbles(alpha: float, nreps: int | None = None) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[object_]][source]#

Identifies the bubble periods in the time series.

A bubble exists when:

\[\text{BSADF}_{r_2} > \text{CV}_{r_2, \alpha}\]
Parameters:

  • alpha (float) – Significance level \(\alpha\).

  • nreps (int | None, optional) – Number of simulations (required if no cache).

Returns:

Array of bubble start and end indices.

Return type:

NDArray[object_]

classmethod from_pandas(y: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[float64]], index: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[_ScalarType_co]] | None = None, r0: float | None = None, rstep: float | None = None, kmax: int = 0, minlength: int | None = None, delta: float | None = None) → PSYBubbles[source]#

Creates a PSYBubbles object from a pandas Series.

Parameters:

  • y (NDArray[float64]) – Time series values.

  • index (NDArray | None, optional) – Index.

  • r0 – See PSYBubbles constructor.

  • rstep – See PSYBubbles constructor.

  • kmax – See PSYBubbles constructor.

  • minlength – See PSYBubbles constructor.

  • delta – See PSYBubbles constructor.

Returns:

Configured object.

Return type:

PSYBubbles

r2grid() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[float64]][source]#

Grid of \(r_2\) values for the BSADF test.

Returns:

Grid \(\{r_2\}\) from \(r_0\) to 1 with step \(r_{\text{step}}\).

Return type:

NDArray[float64]

teststat(force: bool = False) → dict[int, float][source]#

Retrieves the BSADF test statistic.

\[\text{BSADF}_{r_2} = \max_{r_1 \in [0, r_2 - r_0]} \text{ADF}(y_{r_1:r_2})\]
Parameters:

force (bool, optional) – If True, forces recalculation.

Returns:

Test statistic by \(r_2\).

Return type:

dict[int, float]
